I have the honor to submit a letter, just received from W. Thiselton Dyer Esqr,
See W. Thiselton-Dyer to M, 10 April 1891. C.M.G., Director of the Royal Gardens of Kew, in which he offers a duplicate-set of Dr Henry's recently collected (dried) plants from Western China for £22.10. As this region became only opened up within the last few years, this collection is of excep[tional …]
one or 2 lines missing in p/c.
for scientific comparisons, and will also be so for all times in connection with the phytographic treatises emanating already from this collection. I would therefore respectfully seek your permission, that this almost unique collection be secured for the botanic Department under my administration, especially as it is offered at so remarkably low a price. The expenditure can be defrayed out of the ordinary votes of my establishment
McLean approved M's request on 29 May 1891 and on 1 June M returned the file 'with best thanks'. The file was then forwarded to the Commissioners of Audit. The collection in question is now at MEL.
